text: My professor said, "This essay isn't long enough." So I added "very very very" before every adjective. Boom: 12 pages.
Group projects teach teamwork—mostly teaching me to do everything while learning four strangers' Gmail addresses.
Lecture slides at 9 a.m. are just hieroglyphics until caffeine translates them.
Office hours feel like therapy sessions where the therapist says, "That's in chapter 12."
My résumé is basically: "Can work well under Wi-Fi."
I studied so long my Apple Watch asked if I'd been kidnapped.
Midterms are like horror movies—loud screaming, sudden deaths, and snacks running out too fast.
I don't trust squirrels. They act broke, but I've seen their nut savings account.
Penguins are just overdressed ducks refusing to fly economy.
I saw a dog wearing shoes. Meanwhile, I'm out here with holes in mine—guess who's the real underdog.
Campus printers only jam when you're printing the rubric about being on time.
My sleep schedule is a group project where nobody replies and the deadline keeps moving.
I told my sourdough starter we're taking a break; it said "we knead to talk" and bubbled aggressively.
Dating apps feel like lab reports: lots of swiping, one inconclusive result, and the conclusion is always "needs more data."
My cat doesn't respect personal space; she majors in Liquid Dynamics and minorly becomes my hat during Zoom.
Lecture recorded, slides uploaded, still I take notes like I'm sketching a rare bird before it flies.
Microwave popcorn bag said "do not leave unattended" so now we're seeing each other seriously.
I use my tote bag for groceries, textbooks, and carrying the crushing weight of unread PDFs.
Barista asked my name; I said "the protagonist." Best latte arc of my semester.
Professor: "Any questions?" Me: Only the tiny one about life, the universe, and chapter seven.
I often think if I'd taken a different path in life, I could be lying on a slightly more comfortable sofa right now.
I was drinking at the bar, so I took a bus home. That may not be a big deal to you, but I've never driven a bus before!
7% of all hearing loss is a result of sitting in a restaurant next to a table full of women who just received dessert.
You could be a "Before" model.
So today I found out I have Alzheimer's disease... But on the bright side, at least I don't have Alzheimer's disease.
I'm reading a book about anti-gravity... ... It's impossible to put down
I told myself I should stop drinking .. .. but I'm not about to listen to some weirdo that talks to himself
What did the Physics professor say when he forgot his lines of a speech? Give me a moment...ummmm.(momentum)
To the lady who keeps banging on my door at night.. I'm not letting you out.
Two muffins are in an oven The first one turns to the other and says: "It sure is getting hot in here". To which the second muffin replies: "Holy Crap! A talking muffin!"
